page.title: 19RELIGIONS IN HOUNSLOW.
page.content: {Holy Trinity,}Hounslow High Street, is historically the most important{church in Hounslow.It was built on the site of a{priory}established by the {friars of the Holy Trinity in{1211.}Since the influx of{ethnic immigrants}in the early 1960s,Hounslow has developed as a {multi-faith area,}as was shown in a survey of 10 Primary Schools.Schools were asked to give their 3 major religious groups.{50%}gave Christian;{ {40%}Sikh and {10%}Hindu. Of the 10 schools surveyed,2 did not include any Christian Religion. {SRI GURU SINGH SABAH:}Hello.My name is Hardeep Gill.I am a Sikh. My local{ {Gurdwara}is in Hibernia Road,Hounslow. The original site was a factory.In { {1979}the{Sikh Community}in Hounslow bought and converted it. Plans have been approved to build a new Gurdwara there, financed by the Community.
